title: Here's what's new on Hulu in October 2021 — and what's leaving
text:
The Disney DIS-owned streaming service will unveil four originals next month, including “Baker's Dozen” (Oct. 7), a baking competition show with hosts Tamera Mowry-Housley (“Sister, Sister,” “The Real”) and former White House pastry chef  Bill Yosses, and “The Next Thing You Eat” (Oct. 21), a six-episode docuseries from chef David Chang, founder of the Momofuku restaurant chain, about the future of food.

On the more serious side, there's the documentary “Jacinta” (Oct. 8), following a mother and daughter incarcerated together for drug offenses, and the daughter's struggles to stay sober and rebuild her life once she's released; and Hulu's biggest release of the month: “Dopesick” (Oct. 13), a limited series starring Michael Keaton that examines how Purdue Pharma's opioids triggered the worst drug crisis in American history. The first three episodes drop on the 13th, with new episodes every Wednesday.

Hulu also has the season premieres of many network shows a day after they originally air, such as “Saturday Night Live” (Oct. 3), “Shark Tank” (Oct. 9) and “The Bachelorette” (Oct. 18), and is adding a slew of classic James Bond and “Star Trek” movies (all Oct. 1). And just in time for Halloween, there are movies such as “Flatliners,” “Exorcist: The Beginning,” “Teen Wolf” (all Oct. 1) and the 2016 version of “The Rocky Horror Picture Show” (Oct. 3).

Also see: What's coming in October to Netflix | Amazon Prime Video

And: Here's what's worth streaming in October 2021: ‘Succession,' ‘Dune,' ‘You' and much more

Here's the full list of what's coming and going, as of Sept. 20 (release dates ae subject to change):
